name: List events for a repository
description:
**Note:** You can now use emoji in label names, add descriptions to labels, and search for labels in a repository. See the [blog post](/changes/2018-02-22-label-description-search-preview) for full details. To access these features and receive payloads with this data during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](/v3/media) in the `Accept` header:

    application/vnd.github.symmetra-preview+json
    

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

    GET /repos/:owner/:repo/issues/events
    

### [](#response-1)Response

    Status: 200 OK
    Link: <https://api.github.com/resource?page=2>; rel="next",
          <https://api.github.com/resource?page=5>; rel="last"

[](#get-a-single-event)Get a single event[](/apps/ "Enabled for GitHub Apps")
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Note:** You can now use emoji in label names, add descriptions to labels, and search for labels in a repository. See the [blog post](/changes/2018-02-22-label-description-search-preview) for full details. To access these features and receive payloads with this data during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](/v3/media) in the `Accept` header:

    application/vnd.github.symmetra-preview+json
    

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

    GET /repos/:owner/:repo/issues/events/:id

#### [](#issue-events-triggered-by-users-via-integrations)Issue events triggered by users via integrations

**Note:** An additional `performed_via_github_app` object in the issue payload is currently available for developers to preview. For more information, see the [related blog post](/changes/2016-09-14-Integrations-Early-Access).

To access the API, you must provide a custom [media type](/v3/media) in the `Accept` header:

    application/vnd.github.machine-man-preview
    

**Note:** If the event was triggered by a user via a GitHub App, the `performed_via_github_app` key will contain information on that GitHub App.

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

name: Get a single event

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

    GET /repos/:owner/:repo/issues/events/:id

#### [](#issue-events-triggered-by-users-via-integrations)Issue events triggered by users via integrations

**Note:** An additional `performed_via_github_app` object in the issue payload is currently available for developers to preview. For more information, see the [related blog post](/changes/2016-09-14-Integrations-Early-Access).

To access the API, you must provide a custom [media type](/v3/media) in the `Accept` header:

    application/vnd.github.machine-man-preview
    

**Note:** If the event was triggered by a user via a GitHub App, the `performed_via_github_app` key will contain information on that GitHub App.

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).
